column2: NEVADA DMV PRACTICE TEST
column4: Nevada

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
column6: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column8: Make eye contact.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Two-way traffic ahead
column8: Intersection ahead
column10: You can travel in either direction in this lane

column2: 3. If a vehicle is approaching with high beams, drivers should look __________ until the vehicle passes.
column4: to the left of the road
column6: at the center of the road
column8: to the right of the road

column2: 4. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: low clearance.
column8: a low place in the road.

column2: 5. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column6: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column8: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.

column2: 6. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column4: A flashing red light.
column8: A police officer.

column2: 7. What are some telltale signs of a drunk driver?
column4: Sudden stops.
column8: Driving slower than the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 8. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: look toward the right side of the road.
column6: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.
column8: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.
column10: look toward the left side of the road.

column2: 9. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: No one.
column8: You.

column2: 10. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.
column8: stop if necessary.

column2: 11. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Apply the parking brake slowly.
column6: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column8: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column4: Merge, then slow down to the safe speed indicated
column6: Winding road ahead; slow down to the indicated speed
column8: The road ahead curves right; slow down to indicated speed
column10: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated

column2: 13. Drivers under 21 years of age are considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
column4: .08% or higher.
column8: .05% or higher.

column2: 14. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column4: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)
column8: Railroad advance warning signs (round)

column2: 15. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.
column6: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column8: they must not drive past this sign.

column2: 16. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
column4: Better concentration
column8: Better reflexes

column2: 17. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the type of beverage you drink.
column8: the amount of alcohol you drink.

column2: 18. If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
column4: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.
column6: try pumping it to increase pressure.
column8: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column2: 19. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.
column8: enter one of the blind spots and wait.

column2: 20. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
column4: do not enter
column8: wrong Way

column2: 21. If a bus has signaled and is pulling back onto the roadway, you must:
column4: honk to let them know you’re there.
column8: speed up to pass.

column2: 22. This warning sign means:
column4: Slow down, drive with caution and watch for children
column8: Watch out for children crossing the street

column2: 23. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column6: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column8: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column10: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.

column2: 24. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column4: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.
column8: Mirrors are useless.
column10: You should look over your shoulder instead.

column2: 25. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column6: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.
column8: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column10: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
column6: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column8: Bicycle parking ahead

column2: 27. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column4: of two-way traffic
column8: that a reversible lane starts.

column2: 28. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column6: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column8: move as far away from traffic as possible.

column2: 29. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 30. Blind spots are:
column4: lanes reserved for U-turns.
column6: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column8: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column10: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.

column2: 31. Drive below the posted speed limit when:
column4: anything makes conditions less than perfect.
column6: others drive below the speed limit.
column8: entering a highway where there are other cars.
column10: you are on a four lane road.

column2: 32. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column6: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 33. ABS is the acronym for:
column4: Anti-Buzz-Steering
column8: Anti-Braking System

column2: 34. A broken white line:
column4: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column6: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column8: marks the right edge of the roadway.

column2: 35. The picture shows:
column4: a railroad advance warning sign.
column8: a reversible road sign.

column2: 36. Drivers should use the horn:
column4: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.
column6: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.
column8: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column4: Construction zone ahead
column8: Sharp turn, slow down

column2: 38. This road sign means:
column4: One Way
column8: Limited parking

column2: 39. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: Merging traffic ahead
column8: Pedestrian crossing

column2: 40. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
column4: broken white
column8: solid white

column2: 41. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: stop much more slowly
column8: accelerate much faster

column2: 42. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column8: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.
column10: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.

column2: 43. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs:
column4: has no effect, they are different substances.
column6: could multiply the effects of the alcohol.
column8: reduces the effects of the alcohol.
column10: reduces the effects of the drug or medicine.

column2: 44. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column4: A No Passing Zone
column8: School crossing

column2: 45. When driving on wet roads, you should remember:
column4: driving on wet roads can cause hydroplaning.
column6: you should give yourself additional time to stop.
column8: to stay farther behind the vehicle ahead of you.

column2: 46. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 47. This road sign means:
column4: A side road enters ahead
column8: All traffic must turn right

column2: 48. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column4: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.
column8: by the pedestrian.

column2: 49. To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked on a hill, if you are facing uphill you should:
column4: turn the back wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column6: set the parking brake and keep the front wheels straight.
column8: turn the front wheels away from the curb or edge of the road.
column10: turn the front wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.

column2: 50. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column4: steer right
column6: None of the other answers is correct.
column8: steer left
column10: stay in the center of your lane
